items.sentence: Tom said he didn\'t have many friends in Boston.
Tom said he didn\'t want to go swimming with us.
I want Tom to stay where he is until I get back.
I wanted Tom to buy a birthday present for Mary.
Tom told me that he sleeps with the window open.
It\'s easy to lose your footing on loose gravel.
I don\'t want to discourage you from doing that.
I don\'t want to wait any longer than necessary.
Tom tried to tell Mary that he didn\'t like her.
Tom isn\'t the only one who thinks Mary\'s cute.
I don\'t like it when Tom borrows money from me.
Tom and I ended up becoming really good friends.
Tom and I walk to school together every morning.
We couldn\'t keep up with the rest of the group.
We didn\'t do everything we were supposed to do.
We don\'t believe Tom did what Mary said he did.
We don\'t even know if Tom got to Boston or not.
Why did you agree to do this if you\'re so busy?
Why didn\'t you ride your bicycle to work today?
Tom doesn\'t have to make up his mind right now.
